title: Remove capacity wording and add Oregon flower decorative assets

requirements.summary: Remove child-capacity wording from Little Sprouts Program Details on Home and Little Sprouts pages without changing any other fields.
acceptanceCriteria: On /little-sprouts, the Program Details area no longer mentions any specific child capacity (the line currently reading “Limited to 8 children” is removed).
On / (Home), the Little Sprouts details card no longer mentions any specific child capacity (the line currently reading “Capacity: Limited to 8 children” is removed).
No other Program Details fields (ages/schedule/time/cost/etc.) are changed.

file_operations.description: Remove the single Program Details line that mentions capacity (currently “Capacity: Limited to 8 children”) from the Little Sprouts details card while leaving all other details unchanged.

Remove the capacity wording from the /little-sprouts Program Details key-details grid (currently the line “Limited to 8 children” under the Cost tile) while keeping all other Program Details fields intact.

requirements.summary: Add new calm, minimal Oregon flower illustration PNG assets (transparent background) under frontend/public/assets/generated using the required filenames.
acceptanceCriteria: At least three new Oregon-flower illustration PNGs (transparent background) are added to frontend/public/assets/generated using the exact filenames specified in imageRequirements.required.
New assets are visually consistent with the existing nature-themed decorative art (minimal, not cartoonish).

file_operations.description: Add the generated PNG asset for: “Minimal Oregon white oak leaf + acorn line illustration, earthy neutral palette, transparent background”.
Add the generated PNG asset for: “Minimal Oregon grape flower cluster line illustration, earthy neutral palette, transparent background”.
Add the generated PNG asset for: “Minimal camas lily bloom line illustration, earthy neutral palette, transparent background”.
Add the generated PNG asset for: “Minimal trillium bloom line illustration, earthy neutral palette, transparent background”.

requirements.summary: Render the new Oregon flower assets as subtle, non-interactive decorative elements in an existing decorative background layer.
acceptanceCriteria: At least one page displays the new Oregon flower images as subtle decoration (e.g., in the Home page’s existing decorative background layer).
Decorative images do not interfere with content readability (kept low-opacity, behind content, and pointer-events disabled).
All decorative flower images have empty alt text and/or aria-hidden="true" (consistent with existing decorative assets usage).

file_operations.description: In the existing Home page decorative background layer (the absolute, pointer-events-none, low-opacity container), add additional elements referencing: frontend/public/assets/generated/ls-oregon-flower-oak.dim_512x512.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/ls-oregon-flower-oregon-grape.dim_512x512.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/ls-oregon-flower-camas.dim_512x512.png, and frontend/public/assets/generated/ls-oregon-flower-trillium.dim_512x512.png. Ensure they remain behind content, do not affect readability (subtle sizing/positioning), have alt="" and aria-hidden="true", and remain non-interactive (pointer events disabled via the existing container).
